inn1.comm: and he starts on leg stump, a bit of a loosener there from Gul and it's worked calmly into the leg side

gone, and what a tame dismissal that was. Wide of the off stump, Sibanda threw his hands at it, got a thick outside edge to hand a simple catch to Imran Nazir, no less, who took the simplest of catches
short of a length, Akmal goes back and stands on his toes to play an immaculate backward defensive shot
short, pushed hard into the covers, Sean Williams dives to his right to claw the ball back as it seemed to have beaten his dive
slightly short and kept a little low, Akmal back and pushes into the off side
wide, hammered hard but Williams again makes a good stop - it was right at him at cover but he got his body behind that and was on his feet with the ball in a flash
full, on off stump, Nazir blocks it firmly up to mid-off
angled bat to third man, a little outswing and a bit of bounce surprised, but he got over the ball and kept it on the ground
Akmal off the mark, but not convincingly. He looked to flick through the off side but got a thick edge and the ball bobbled down to long leg
Nazir reaches for that, prodding the ball to point
punched off the back foot, a quick call of "no" as they realise Williams is the fielder in the covers
outside off stump and left alone
short, pulled, not timed, a yard to the left of a diving midwicket. Uppish and not controlled. He needed more height on that ...
down the leg side and an easy call for the umpire
uppish backfoot drive in the air through gully
solid forward defensive shot back down the pitch
textbook cover drive, superbly placed and four all the way ... the batsmen barely bothered running
another drive, but not as well timed, it still finds the gap and they run two as Gary Brent slides and throws
this time Mpofu drops it too short - still outside off stump - and the ball is smacked into another gap, four more and not a good over from Mpofu
forward, a thick inside edge down to long leg, lots of "oohs" from the fielders
full, driven back at Mupariwa who is down well to field the ball at his feet
forward defensive, another inside edge which squirts to square leg

seamed in, tip and run into the leg side, a sharp single and both Nazir and Utseya throw themselves full length at the striker's end ... the underarm misses the stumps but they collide anyway and end up in a heap
limp spar at one outside off stump, a poor shot, neither attacking nor defending
prodded into the off side
on the right line, back and blocked
very wide, a slashed drive flies high to the right of first slip and races to the rope. It was a no-ball but he would have played that shot regardless
outside off stump, left alone, a hint of inswing but only after the ball was had passed the batsman
solid defensive shot, everything right, into the covers
wide, a bit more bounce than Akmal expected, and his backfoot swish met thin air
good ball, met with another immaculate defensive block
little more than a firm push to the left of mid-off, but Mpofu had ground to make up and that allowed the run
left outside the off stump. Biding his time ...
decent line, back and blocked
too full, in the slot, and Akmal punches that to the right of cover, never a chance of anyone catching that
overcorrection, sprayed wide down the leg side
slower ball, solid block
forward, opens the face of the bat and steers it straight to point
Akmal back on his stumps, pushes gently  to midwicket
outside off, pushed with an open face to the man in the deep
shortish and it got a bit bigger than Akmal thought, it rapped him on the glove and he headed towards square leg like a man who has shut his hand in the kitchen cupboard

weak backfoot prod, no footwork, he chased it and a thin edge was caught by Taylor, although he did his best to drop it, as he has a number of other balls in the tournament to date. But he clung on, and Zimbabwe have the breakthrough
same line but Malik not remotely tempted
slightly shot, well played into the covers, Malik over it
full, driven on the bounce back to the bowler
confident defensive push to cover
tight line, again no room for anything other than a block
gentle inswing, Nazir cramped and he can only squeeze the ball into the leg side where Utseya races in to end any thoughts of a run
right forward, bat and pad jammed together
again enough inswing to cause the batsman to think, and he  plays the ball to mid-off
firm drive back at the bowler's feet, he drops down, almost diving forward, and stops the ball with a combination of hands, body and legs. Effective but not gainly
dainty on drive, one foot in the air as he walks into it, but mid-on fields with ease
full on middle stump, flicked drive to mid-on
groundhog day ... another flowery drive to mid-on. He is finding the fielder with impressive regularity
effort ball - 84mph - wide of off stump and left alone
forward, not quite right there, but it did the job
that one kept a tad low, Malik jabbed down it well
short and wide, Nazir threw the kitchen sink at that and missed
pushed to cover, Nazir took a step down the track and then thought better of trying for the quick single
short and wide once more, and Nazir again tries to hit the cover off the ball. This time he connects, but utterly mistimes his shot and it dribbles up to mid-off when he was aiming square
good delivery, full and straight, plopped out into the leg side
finally he finds the meat, stepping back and hitting a rasping drive through the covers. It pulls up just short, but a good stroke
Malik back and into line
blocked to cover
slashed drive, in the air down to third man and it falls a inch short of Gary Brent who had raced in to try for what would have been a great catch
slower ball, Nazir cuts at air and the ball bobbles through to Taylor
too full, Nazir leans into that and smashes the ball high over extra cover

tip and run to cover, a quick call of yes, Chibhabha races in and throws at the stumps at the bowler's end ... he misses with Nazir a yard short and a wild throw is well gathered by the man backing up
a low-key end to the over, blocked
wide and a massive and rather wild heave which misses by some way ... that would have been a great shot had the ball been two feet straighter
much better line, solid defensive shot, quite a contrast to the previous stroke
that's what we expect ... two steps down the track and he smashes that ball over midwicket, it clears the rope by a foot or two ... so he clearly didn't middle it
forward defensive from the crease
turned to midwicket
massive shout for leg-before and you can see why ... it was through a defensive prod, it hit him halfway up and looked to be taking out leg stump
short and Malik, a little surprised, had to jerk his head out of the way as that climbed on him. It actually cleared his head, and he was jumping as well
turned behind square on the leg, they completed an easy two even though the fielder did not have too far to run
outside off stump, left alone
full, straight drive, Mpofu drops his right hand down to field
whipped off middle and leg, two easy runs to the man in the deep
just short of a length, Malik back and meets the ball with a dead bat
wild down the leg side, and even a better keeper than Taylor would have struggled with that. Standing up, he had no chance
cut to point, some hesitation and he had to scramble to complete the run as Williams came in and shied at the bowler's end stumps
pushed block to cover
up and over drive, Matsikenyeri at mid-on is up and so has to run back and was never going to get the ball
that one was middled, swatted disdainfully over cow corner, and some
outside off and Malik opts late to leave it
defensive push into the covers. An expensive start for Brent, 14 off the over
outside off, left alone ... we think!
Nazir shapes to pull a short one, gets a top edge, and takes a blow in the helmet  for his pains
into the leg side
two steps, a shimmy to leg, and that one almost cleared the rope over long-on, even without any real follow through
Mpofu back with a good ball, on the spot
into the off side, finds the fielder and not the gap
on a good length and it's pushed out to over - oh, good, quick bit of running there
just short of a length this time, also hurrying onto the batsman who was in two minds, eventually deciding to cut it off the back foot
short, wide and flayed on the front foot, ungainly so, over point and wide of third man who sprints to his right and makes a good stop
much better line this time, swinging into the batsman - fuller length, too - who comes forward solidly, head over the ball, defending it watchfully
down the leg side - good piece of work from the keeper, shuffling to his left and whipping off the bails in a vain attempt to distract the umpire...but it's a wide
ooh, not a great shot; slashed on the up, over point and again wide of third man. Not fully in control of that shot. In fact, no control
very nicely bowled - an excellent length, pushed out to cover. But again his feet weren't moving and again he wasn't fully in control of the shot
edging into the right hander, spitting up on him too, and he defends it to leg off the back foot
again short of a length, just short of a length and cutting back into the batsman who defends off the back foot with a straight bat
full and straight, he comes forward pushing it out to cover and they scamper a single
short of a length and pushed out into the covers
skips down the pitch and the bowler sees him coming, sends it down short and wide. And he misses it spectacularly
oh, that's delightful as Blowers would say. On the front foot and elegantly creamed through cover for an emphatic, pleasing four
short of a length, flat, and quick, it's defended off the back foot
far too short and straight, on middle, and Nazir simply rocks back with all the time in the world, hammering it in front of square. No stopping that
a slightly fuller length but Nazir's in fine touch now, just dabbing this into the off side and they sprint a single
gone! Very well bowled indeed. He came charging down the pitch too early - Williams saw him coming, dropped it in short and the batsman dabbed it to Chibhabha at point
right back in his crease, Inzamam whips it to leg, timing it very nicely but straight to midwicket
full, flat and just a little wide of his leg stump, Inzamam nudges it away
a rather ugly, loose ball - short and wide - which takes the batsman by surprise somewhat. Tries to cut it but can only smack it into the ground and it bobbles into the covers for a single
short, straight bouncer which Inzamam evades with ease, just turning his head
on leg stump and Inzamam heaves at it, massively, sending it aerially through midwicket
short and straight but he's quickly back onto his stumps, pulling it powerfully to the man at deep square leg
rather too full to be cutting. But he cuts nonetheless without timing
and he has absolutely laced that off the back foot, in front of square - so hard, in fact, that the camera has trouble tracking it
on leg stump, Inzamam comes forward to pad it away
ever so slightly straighter and fuller, allowing Inzamam to sweep, which he does very cleanly, straight to deep square leg
firmly blocked out on the front foot
and a good line, too, just on leg stump - not quite an Ashley Giles line - and it's defended
worked around the corner. Will he come back for two? No...not with Inzy there
just short enough to cut and Inzamam - so quick on his feet - steps back and clunks it hard to cover. Too hard, in fact, to steal a run
half a shout for lbw as he sweeps around the corner
too full and straight, easily clipped to long-on with a touch of lazy class there
pushed to cover
well, that is quite enourmous. A skip down the pitch and he smacks it over long-on for a superb six
just nudges this for a single
on off stump, padded away - half a shout for lbw but he was well outside the line
on leg stump and Inzamam is watchful in defence
on middle stump, swept with typical Inzamam timing and power to the vacant deep square leg, but a great piece of fielding prevents four
short of a length, clunked off the back foot to cover and they steal a single
huge power from Inzamam, quite magnificent. Half a step down the pitch and he times it, quite brilliantly, over long-off for a flat, terrifying six
nudged to leg
flat and straight - but a no ball
defended on the front foot
defended on the front foot
turned around the corner neatly
ooh, didn't get hold of that. Down the pitch, trying to smash it over long-on but got a thick inside edge and it fell short of deep midwicket
superb shot, swept down to the vacant fine leg. So well placed by Inzamam
and he simply pushes this into the gap at cover for another single
and he tries to do an Inzamam, slogging across the line, but again he can't time it and it bobbles out meekly to midwicket
too short, Nazir sees it quickly and pulls it behind square for four. Hit in the air, but into the gap. Neatly played
hurries onto Nazir but he's quick to rock back, turning his wrists to flick the ball to leg
short again, Inzamam - in this mood, he can't resist - hooks it, gets a top-edge and it falls just short of the two men behind square
turned to leg
too short, but he gets away with it as Nazir's pull is mistimed
ooh ouch. I think that's hit Inzamam in the midriff
Inzamam tries to cut this with savage power but can't time it
flat and quick, too quick, and it's pushed to leg without timing
flat again - this is clever bowling - and Inzamam pushes it off the back foot to mid-on
a full toss which Inzy doesn't read, meekly pushing it back to the bowler
sees Inzamam coming who runs down the pitch with furious intent, the ball spearing down the leg side
beautiful wrists there, turning it through midwicket
a touch too short, rising on the batsman who plays it to leg - immediately wants a single, but Inzamam isn't moving
too straight this time and it is neatly turned to leg
magnificent! Shot of the day, in my book. On leg stump and he just swung through the line, picked it up with languid ease over midwicket for another six
a better length this time, on off stump. Inzamam defends
well bowled. A slower ball but the batsman is up to the task, defended it on the front foot
crashed to cover. But straight to cover
aggressive intent from Nazir, skipping down the pitch to "do an Inzamam" but he can't. Drags across the line
pushed back to the bowler
lucky...lucky. Done in the flight, Nazir mistimes it over the bowlers head and it just creeps over for six
an ungainly - well, it was ugly to be honest - heave across the line and it races for four through midwicket
on off stump, he steps across to meet the line and whips it to leg. Lovely shot
crisply pinged to mid-off
short of a length which rises on Inzamam, causing him to defend it when he really wanted to hit it back down the ground
punched to cover, without really timing it
turned to leg

fine catch, a very fine catch to end a brilliant batsman's one-day career. Inzamam trying to launch another six over long-on but got an outside edge behind Williams' head  at mid-off who jogged back and took it in front of his nose. Fine catch
pushed to leg
and it's nudged away to end the over
and it's pushed out into the covers, without really timing it
far too short, crashed through cover - timed it beautifully but straight to the sweeper on the fence
excellent ball on middle-and-off, full too, and defended on the front foot
just short of a good length, the batsman rocks back and turns his wrists, nurdling it to leg
outside off, flayed with a flourish off the outside edge down to Sibanda at third man
good end to the over, on off stump and it's calmly, watchfully defended
ooh big shout there as he's trapped in front - looked very close but Hawkeye suggests the ball was going over the top
just drifting a touch down the leg side, Nazir flicks powerfully down to fine leg for four
close! Very, very close as Nazir came forward to defend, with a wafty, airy blade and got a thick inside edge
wafty defence again, this time from Yousuf, just hanging the bat out to dry and it passes through to the wicketkeeper
but he defends solidly this time, off the back foot with his head right over the ball. Much better
gorgeously flicked off his pads, flamingo-style - beautifully played
back, across and run to point
sweetly and deftly steered through where slip would usually be
dropped ... hit very high and straight to Kasteni at deep backward square leg, ten yards inside the rope and he never had to move. He did everything right, except catch it
half volley, hit  straight back at Brent who holds a comfortable return catch without any alarms. A tame dismissal but one which Zimbabwe needed as Pakistan were beginning to press on
short outside off, push and run to cover, they take on Williams' arm and win
short, wide, and got exactly what it deserved, smacked through extra cover with added vim
back, pushed towards point for a well-run single
he takes a step forward, and then rocks back and pulls the ball wide of midwicket
waits and then runs in behind square on the leg
right back on his stumps and blocks
waits, watches, and turns to leg, but this time no run
leans forward and pushes firmly to mid-on
inside edge, through Taylor on the leg side - not a catch - and goes very fine
outside off, looks to cut but misses and well taken
slow - very slow - yorker, too wide, dug out to cover
punched off the back foot to mid-on
pushed to cover, an easy one, and cover's throw, which was no more than a flick back to Taylor, goes way beyond the keeper but backing up is good
Younis has to stretch to reach that - it would have been a wide - and squeezes it to cover
short, pulled to longish-on who made good ground to get that
back, waits and then pushes into space. Good batting
again happy to go back and wait for the ball, and then flick it into space on the leg
too short, he steps back and cuts that through point, to the left of the sweeper and that allowed them to come back for the second
prodded limply to cover
deftly flicked round the corner
firm punch to the sweeper on the boundary
well hit to the sweeper
to cover, a loud shout of no as they spit Williams rushing in
crisp poke to point
flicked into the leg side to take him to 99
back, paddled to midwicket
drops the ball into the off side, it goes almost nowhere, but both men are off like greyhounds and Williams, quick as he is, can't prevent the single
into the covers. nothing to Williams this time, it was hit too hard
leans back and cracks the ball, but once again Williams is in the right place
steered straight to the man at backward point
one step to off and launched many a mile over straight midwicket ... he put everything into that and it cleared the rope by about ten rows
seamed back as he tried to cut, it clattered into his gloves but ran slowly into the slip area and Taylor could not prevent the single
good length, blocked
dead batted into the covers, and easy one
steps back and wristily whips the ball of the stumps behind square on the leg. A high-risk shot ...
driven off the back foot and a diving stop by the sub, Dabengwa, in the covers. It bounced kindly for him, but an athletic save
ill-timed drive which bounces back to the bowler
super yorker, drifting into the right hander and he has to settle for digging the ball out
short, he went for the hook but it got too big on him, and he checked the shot but still got a top edge and it bumbled for a fine four (fine as in straight and not superb!)
Younis takes a stride, walks across his stumps and turns the ball to leg
one step to leg, and heaved over long-on, half a dozen rows back. That was clubbed not timed, but it was very effective
full toss, Mpofu has lost his composure, and again clubbed, slightly squarer, but it rockets to the rope
slower ball, Nazir heaves but he was nowhere near it, and the umpire thinks it was wide enough to be called. Mpofu appealed but the noise was bat on ground
remarkable shot, off the toe end of the bat - had he middled it it might still be travelling - and over the bowler, long-off round to field
wide, steered past backward point for a single
quick single into the off side, again close but these two are running well. The throw was wild anyway
half volley, driven uppishly but hard to long-off. Quite safe, quite effective
worked into the leg-side open spaces, and there are plenty as Utseya looks to save boundaries
slog-sweep with real power for a big six over square leg
gets in a bit of a mess and no run as the ball bobbles into the off
another big blow, a step and a perfect straight drive, over Utseya and over the rope. The Pakistani big guns are now finding their range ... and they Afridi next man in!
single to leg to get Nazir on strike
and that's why ... smashed from off stump over midwicket. That was in the perfect slot for him to play that shot
late change of shot, quite delicately run off the face of the bat through the slips
steps back and punches that to long-on
dropped ... reverse sweep off the face of the bat into Taylor's gloves ... and out again
a tame end to a remarkable over, worked to the man in the deep on the off

driven to the man in the deep on the off, Younis Khan came back for the second and had the thrown from Mpofu been spot on that would have been easily out ... as it is it's referred to the third umpire and Younis is six inches short. We've knocked Taylor a few times but he did really well there to gather the high return and whip the bails off, and Mpofu did a great job in the deep
defensive push to cover, he was off for the run before he had hit the ball

dropped straight drive, hit high and hard, Chigumbura was under it, he took the catch but in doing so he stepped back over the rope, and only then did he toss the ball back onto the field. Trouble was, he was going backwards as he caught it and as such his momentum took him over the boundary
slashed over cover, hit really hard and only one outcome
touch after tonking, clipped fine on the leg side
push-block back to relieved bowler
pushed to cover, an easy run and Williams seems to have given up charging in all the time. He's rightly dropped a yard or two deeper and is concentrating on saving the big hits
prodded up to long-off
full toss - with a cry of "Ahhh" from Brent - which is turned into space through midwicket
slower ball, spotted, and Nazir waits and works it to point
expansive slash, his feet where nowhere near the pitch of the ball, and it shoots over the absent slips. They came back for a second and should have struggled but Chigumbura's throw was wild
Afridi has one intention here, as his swing and miss shows
sweetly clipped to backward square leg. That;s his 150, 21 balls from 100 to 150.
Afridi launches a massive heaven-scraping hit over long-on. It came down with snow on it, ten rows back
full toss, and a slower ball, and that's enough to deceive  Afridi  who swings and gets a thin edge into his body
too full and a rasping off drive, perfectly placed
tip and run into the off side
slower ball, clubbed over midwicket, he didn't get hold of it and it stops 20 yards in from the rope. That's a shot which has brought him so many runs today
slower ball ... so slow it needed motion detectors to track ... Afridi played all round it and was bowled round his legs
pushed to long-on, effortless and no power, but there are spaces everywhere
a rather tired heave, not really hit properly, and the ball scoots to long-on
flicked to long-on, he had to run in quickly to prevent a second
full toss, slammed out of the ground over wide long-on

dropped driven to long-on, Chibhabha races in to try for the catch -  he doesn't make it - technically a drop -  but he saves the four, the ball shooting off his knee to long-off who completes the fielding

super catch by Matsikenyeri at deepish extra cover. Nazir looked to drive the ball but it was wide and he had to reach for it. He connected, but with limited power, and Matsikenyeri, the shortest man in the side, took a few steps back, jumped and held the ball above his head as he fell
driven to long-off
pushed towards long-on, no power and it needed midwicket to scurry round to prevent a second
wide and left ... this really is a case of after the Lord Mayor's Show
good length, Sami has to go back and his rather limp swish misses the ball by some way
mistimed drive, bobbles to midwicket
that one spat off a length and Taylor took the ball well as it beat the prod
slow and wide ... too wide
another slower ball, driven to long-on. "Good work," chirrups Taylor
quicker, shorter, and Iftikhar has to hurry to fend the ball into the leg side
slower ball, a quite ugly heave which almost lifts the batsman off his feet, Taylor whips off the bails but no appeal
mistimed flick to leg, it ends up as a nothing shot, the ball loops to Matsikenyeri at midwicket and he has to dive forward - almost in slow motion - to complete the catch
Brent drifts to leg, sweetly clipped behind on the leg side and past the despairing dive of the man in on the one
squeezed down to third man, the fielder is square and has a lot of ground to make up and the ball just beats his dive
checked drive over the bowler's head, safe and an easy one

dropped hit high to Williams at deep square leg, he gets right under it, tries to catch the ball  in front of his face ... and drops it. That's a real shame, Williams has been the outstanding fielder for this side, and in the tournament so far
pushed into the covers, an easy single
an amazing shot, driven on the up and the ball went as if out of a rocket, searing over extra cover for a one-bounce four
a dot ball to finish, straight and treated with respect
class shot, befitting a top-order batsman, one step and driven on the half volley through the covers
banged in short and down the leg, a wide by either criteria
paddled into the leg side
flicked over midwicket, no backlift but  a good connection, and it falls between the man in the deep and the one saving the single
pushed to long-on
Gul takes a big step towards leg and aims an expansive slam through the covers,  Chigumbura fires in an off-stump yorker and it's  too good for the tailender
bad ball, well played. A leg-side full toss, helped on its way
turned to midwicket, Williams picks ups, has time to set his sights, but his throw was wide. In fairness, he had one stump to aim at, no more
push and run to long-on
steps to leg and drives that ball square - he had to reach for it - and two to the man in the deep
pushed to Williams at midwicket, again he is in well but his throw at the bowler's end misses the stumps. The batsman was trotting, almost you hit and I'm out
short and Kaneria takes a painful blow on his right shoulder as he aimed to swish it over midwicket
to sweeper, an easy single
sweet drive to the cover boundary where Mpofu round quickly
a jumpy prod to leg by Kaneria
utter class, one stride to off and nonchalantly flicked over the square-leg boundary for six. A shade of Viv Richards at Lord's in 1979 when he deposited Mike Hendrick into the Mound Stand
an even bigger hit, not as classy but just as effective, a full toss swiped over midwicket
cross-batted swipe which Matsikenyeri at cow corner takes with ease

inn2.comm: a bit of a loosener there; on leg stump and it's worked to leg

gone, and what a tame dismissal that was. Wide of the off stump, Sibanda threw his hands at it, got a thick outside edge to hand a simple catch to Imran Nazir, no less, who took the simplest of catches
wide of the off stump, and a swing-and-a-miss
on leg stump, right back in his stumps and it's defended on the back foot
straighter this time and it's rather squirted into the covers. No feet movement
good end to the over, finding one to bounce on the left hander. Too quick for him, mind; his hopeful swish outside off found nothing but thin air
ooh, uppishly driven past point down to third man. Not a lot of control in that stroke to Sami's loosener, but they're off the mark with a single
a crunching square drive is smacked straight to point
just a touch outside off stump, he attempts to drive it back past the bowler but, with a rather angled bat, he can only push it back to the bowler
jumps up on the batsman who gets himself into an awkward position, fending it off his chest down to his feet
excellent delivery on off stump, just angling back in slightly to the left hander. To his credit, he came forward confidently and was solid in defence
just like that. A little too short, but it left the batsman and spat up viciously
again Gul's first ball of a new over is speared down the leg side, allowing the batsman to flick him down to fine leg and they pick up a single
nearly. Full, just wide of the off stump and he can't resist it. Like a moth to a flame, he throws everything at it - missing it comprehensively
driven quite confidently, but straight to cover
a cracking delivery which left the batsman's defensive waft
bounce and pace, and again he flays his hands at it. Again he misses
more fishing from Kasteni. He could've lost his wicket at least five times so far. Again it leaves him enough to beat his wafting blade
pushes this out into the covers - and he's off the mark. A quick single to mid-off - but no! He'll get four overthrows, and he's beaming like a proverbial Cheshire cat
spits up on him but he plays it neatly, riding the bounce, dropping it down into the covers and they steal a single
poor delivery down the leg side, easily flicked down to fine leg
short and wide outside off - he can't resist uppercutting it, and it flies down to third man
good line this time, just outside off. Firmly defended by the right hander who rocks back and, with a very straight bat, defends off the back foot before roaring "no"
disappointing shot, but it was nice and quick from Sami. Like Gul, he's extracting encouraging bounce and this lifted disconcertingly on the batsman who tried to uppercut it
extraordinary shot to a decent-length delivery, trying to loft it over long-on (or midwicket, I suppose). Nowhere near it
punched to mid-off. Firmly played
ah, lovely ball, pitching on off before leaving the left hander at the last moment. Banana swing
and this one is an inswinger, which he reads, and defends out to cover
well run, a cheeky single to one he nudged, and deadened, to the leg side
ouch. A heavy ball, reasonably full but nevertheless it spat up and was fended off the glove
a really dreadful stroke, charging Gul - trying to hit him over the top. A thick outside edge presents Inzamam with a straightforward chance, head-height, at first slip
the wrong line, drifting down leg, and it's worked around the corner
and he's off the mark immediately, dropping this into the leg side and sprinting through for a single
well, just too fast for him. Short and quick, rising up towards his throat and, with no foot movement, an injudicious swipe hands Inzamam his second catch at slip
too straight and he works it behind square leg, much to Sami's anguish who roars in frustration
nearly a third catch for Inzamam as the batsman, with concrete feet, swings and misses, his head pointed towards the sky
much better. He went back into his crease this time, tentatively (and slightly) across to the off stump to defend off the back foot
just a bit too straight, allowing an easy whip to leg for a single...though they consider a second before wisely deciding against it
good leave outside off. Good line, good pace - and well left
full and wide, splurged to point
defended on the front foot
just a little too short now, and it's worked off the back foot to point. Worked quite comfortably, too, albeit straight to the fielder
a beautiful delivery angling into the right hander before cutting away from his defensive post
a bouncer which he easily evades. His choice of evasion is the duck
good leave outside off
neat looking stroke, timing it very well on the front foot and guiding it through extra cover
a belting delivery! Swinging into the right hander who played the wrong line, misreading the movement, and he very nearly got an edge
better; defended solidly on the front foot
frankly too wide, and swinging wider, but the batsman nevertheless went for it, driving with a flourish and missing it spectacular
not a clue what he was trying to do there. Too full to be cutting, if indeed he was trying to cut. It looked more like he was trying to loft a half-volley over mid-on
on off stump and it's defended solidly on the front foot
good bounce and it proves too much for the batsman who steps to leg, trying to cut it, and misses
steps to leg, cutting it past point down to third man. Better stroke and well timed
on off stump - and this time he's right behind it, defending it on the back foot
left alone outside off
a gentle away-swinger which is wisely left alone
defended on the back foot
nice cut to point
driven just past the bowler who dives to his right to stop it, parrying it behind him
short and down the leg side, rightly called a wide
short and again swinging down the leg side. He takes an enormous hippo-heave at it, attempting to smack it over midwicket, but a thick outside edge sends it down to third man. For four
swinging into his pads but it's going down leg
short. Wide. Clobbered off the back foot through cover
nudged to leg and they take a quick single...
driven through the covers, chased on tip toe by the fielder ... the outfield is very wet!
pleading appeal for leg-before nothing doing. Hawkeye says ... out
padded and bodied away
smashed to long-on, Yousuf fields with his foot on the edge of the field, it's clearly wet and they are taking no risks, all very ginger ... like Gnasher
wide and absolutely hammered to sweeper who stops with body and soul
hit high over cover, well struck and that's a one-bounce four
missed attempted cut
another attempted cut, again missed, pushed through by the bowler
cut to point, the batsman is left stranded by a quick pick-up and Akmal dislodges the bail without the ball
cut behind square
swung high to Younis Khan who ran in from the deep midwicket boundary and held the catch well. A tough one out of the gloom and with no real grip underfoot

big heave from Matsikenyeri and he misses, Akmal goes for the stumping and he is back in ... sadly, the runner, Taylor, is standing a foot out of the crease, blissfully ignorant that he actually needs to be back inside the crease as well.
spins into the left-handers, a loud leg-before appeal, but it was going down the leg
flicked down to leg, well played
swung to backward square leg
full toss, swept to deep square leg
a step down the ground, readjusts well and cuts
a big swing and an even bigger miss
another swing, this time he connects and it goes a mile over long-on, no spin and that was thumped
single into the leg side
Williams shapes to flick to leg, misses, and an optimistic appeal is turned down
tickled to short fine leg
flicked to square leg
that's gone into orbit, smacked into the upper tier over long-on. It's fun ... all in vain, but fun
and again! This time a full toss is smashed over cow corner into the empty stands
another one, hit flat and hard, it never got more than eight feet off the ground, wide of long-on
speared in at his feet .. hit that if you can!
heaved square - he didn't get hold of that
another big swing but he misses, it's straight, and he's gone down in a blaze of hitting
red it at leg stump, dug out
cut, missed, too close to the stumps for that
on leg stump, a swing but he misses
pushed off the back foot to point ...another quick delivery at 80mph!
swung over straight midwicket, into space but not with enough power to get near the boundary
one run to deepish point
a big heave to leg, he misses and an appeal from Kaneria ... not a chance
same ball, same shot, but this time he really middles it and sends it out of the ground, it bounces on the stand roof and onwards to freedom
full, he waits and punches it back past a flailing Kaneria and up to long-off
one step, it was wide, he reached and drove that back over long-on. That's five sixes off Kaneria who cannot grip it
Williams goes for another big hit, this time he doesn't get over it and Gul races in from long-on and holds on easily to a steepler
off spin at 79mph, pushed through the covers
straight and much slower - 62mph - and Brent swings and misses, losing his middle stump
wide outside off ... 50mph ... he's slowing fast
flighted, no shot
and he's bowled him with the wrong un at 48mph, and he punches the air in delight
quickest of the lot, 81mph, missed the bat and the stumps
short, heaved and the ball just misses the top of the stumps
pushed into the leg side
ugly heave to leg
short, pulled backward of square and it thuds into the soft turf and plugs
into the off side, no run
outside off, well wide
very wide, he used his full reach and steered that to deep cover
slow and loopy, driven to cover where Inzamam holds the catch. Huge grins all round, and Yousuf has not smiled more when he's scored hundreds. Even Simon Taufel can't help grinning
